name: Snabb
body:
# What is this?
Is a compilation about snippets that I found over internet and put them together to work as a micro framework for PHP.

# How to use it?

First you download, fork or clone the repository. And add a couple of files to have your site running.

Here is how you can use it:
## Routes

This modules is from a github repo ([php-rails-routing](https://github.com/infostreams/php-rails-routing)). I made some modifications. In order to resolve controller Class, action (instance method) and view.

### Defining routes

Go to folder `config` and open `routes.php` 

and add your routes as follow:

`// mapping for http://<location>/hello/`
`$r->map("/hello", "hello::world");`

where:

 * "/hello" is a route on your site
 * "hello::world" is a mixed term controller::action

so router will runs 

`// ->  HelloController->worldAction()`

### Defining controllers

In the `app/controllers` folder you put the controllers to handle your routes

the convention name is <ControllerName>Controller.php

controllers are clases like follow:

`<?php`
`class HelloController {`

  `//Action related to route`
  `public function worldAction() {`
     `return [ "title" => "Hello World!" ] ;`
  `}`

`}`
`?>`

### Authors and Contributors
You can @mention a GitHub username to generate a link to their profile. The resulting `<a>` element will link to the contributor's GitHub Profile. For example: In 2007, Chris Wanstrath (@defunkt), PJ Hyett (@pjhyett), and Tom Preston-Werner (@mojombo) founded GitHub.
